item.title: Emmy Newbies Rule as Winners Mostly Stay Away From Politics
item.description: TV veterans Noah Wyle, Cristin Milioti, Seth Rogen, Britt Lower and Jeff Hiller all proved it’s never too late to get television’s top honor, as ‘The Studio’ and ‘The Pitt’ won best series at the Emmy

item.title: Emmys Raise $350,000 for Boys and Girls Club After Host Nate Bargatze’s Speech Donation Pledge
item.description: The 2025 Emmys host promised to donate $100,000 at the top of the show, though the number decreased every time a winner’s acceptance speech went over 45 seconds.

item.description: The 2025 Emmys host promised to donate $100,000 at the top of the show, though the number decreased every time a winner’s acceptance speech went over 45 seconds.

item.title: Emmy Host Nate Bargatze (Gently) Mocks Nominees With ‘SNL’-Inspired Sketch
item.description: The family friendly comedian opened the 2025 awards show by poking fun at ‘The Bear’ and streamers.

item.title: Nate Bargatze: “Big Dumb” Mogul
item.description: Forget the Porsche, the sold-out arenas, the theme park. The world’s most successful stand-up — and this year’s Emmy host — swears he’s still just a regular guy.

item.title: Yes, Nate Bargatze Is Dead Serious About That Theme Park
item.description: Welcome to Nateland, the company that’s also cooking up family-friendly movies, koozies, cruises, specials and podcasts.

item.title: 2025 Emmys Host Nate Bargatze Nominated for ‘Your Friend’ Comedy Special
item.description: The comic juggernaut got two Emmy nods for his third stand-up special on Netflix.
